newsitem.title: USA: Sub-Sahara African trade bill introduced.
newsitem.headline: Sub-Sahara African trade bill introduced.

text.p: A bill to promote trade with sub-Saharan Africa was introduced on Thursday by several U.S. House members.

"By providing sub-Saharan African countries with trade and investment opportunities, this important legislation will encourage the type of economic and political reforms necessary to help this region grow and eventually prosper," House Trade Subcommittee Chairman Phil Crane, R-Illinois, said in a statement.

The bill calls for the negotiation of a free trade agreement with sub-Saharan countries that take steps to reform their economices. It would also encourage private investment in established businesses and infrastructure projects in the region and create a U.S.-sub-Saharan Africa Trade and Economic Cooperation Forum to provide regular opportunities for policy leaders and heads of state to meet.
No action on the bill is expected before Congress adjourns for the year in a few days, but the legislation will be re-introduced when the next session begins in January.
